meanings.definition: The use of lies or tricks to cheat or take advantage of in a way that is often against the law.
examples: The dishonest player went to jail for committing fraud and cheating other people.

images.alt: Photo of a card up a person's sleeve.
images.description: A person's arm is showing. The person is wearing a jacket and a shirt. A card is showing partway out of the sleeve of the person's coat.
images.caption: This person is committing fraud, or cheating, by having a card up their sleeve.

meanings.definition: To show something that you usually cannot see.
examples: The gardener dug into the dirt and exposed the roots of the tree.

images.alt: Photo of a plant and its roots.
images.description: A plant with its roots showing.
images.caption: The roots of this plant are out of the dirt and are exposed.

source.title: Green seedling of chives on marble table
source.author: Karolina Grabowska

examples: The optical illusion made us think that the room was moving, but it was not.

images.alt: Photo of three glasses in front of a painted background.
images.description: Three classes in front of a background painted in two colors, green on the left and red on the right. The glasses are partly filled with clear liquid. Looking through the liquid in the glass on the far left, you can see  a stripe of red on the furthest left curve of the glass, and then mostly green. Looking at the middle glass, you can see red on the left and green on the right, opposite of what is in the background. Looking at the glass on the far right, you can see mostly red, with a stripe of green on the far right.
images.caption: The liquid in the glass makes the background colors flip, giving the illusion that they are painted opposite of what they actually are.

meanings.definition: The work a person chooses to do through life.
examples: She wants to have a career as a scientist.

images.alt: Photo of a doctor wearing a white lab coat.
images.description: Photo of a doctor wearing a white lab coat.
images.caption: This person has a career as a doctor.

meanings.definition: The act of causing someone to believe something that is not true.
examples: He used lies and deception to steal money from people.

meanings.definition: To try to find; look for.
examples: Weiss ran away from home when he was just 12 years old in order to earn money and seek adventure on his own.

images.alt: Photo of a person with her hand blocking sun from her eyes.
images.description: A person blocking sun from her eyes, looking into the distance.
images.caption: A person looking, or seeking, something.

source.title: Photo of Woman Squatting on Graffiti Wall Posing While Looking Away
source.author: Ana Arantes

meanings.definition: To try to find; look for.
examples: Weiss ran away from home when he was just 12 years old in order to earn money and pursue adventure on his own.

images.alt: Photo of a person with her hand blocking sun from her eyes.
images.description: A person blocking sun from her eyes, looking into the distance.
images.caption: A person looking for, or pursuing something.

source.title: Photo of Woman Squatting on Graffiti Wall Posing While Looking Away
source.author: Ana Arantes

meanings.definition: To join two things or two sides of something so that they stay together.
examples: In this trick, Houdini's ankles were secured in a brace and he was put under water, upside down and locked in place in full view of the audience.

images.alt: Photo of two sides of a gate chained together.
images.description: Photo of two sides of a gate held together with a chain and lock.
images.caption: The chain secures the two sides of this gate together.

meanings.definition: To join two things or two sides of something so that they stay together.
examples: In this trick, Houdini's ankles were fastened in a brace and he was put under water, upside down and locked in place in full view of the audience.

images.alt: Photo of two sides of a gate chained together.
images.description: Photo of two sides of a gate held together with a chain and lock.
images.caption: The chain fastens the two sides of this gate together.

examples: What happened was the person committing the fraud would make a mold of a dead person's hand.
What happened was the person perpetrating the fraud would make a mold of a dead person's hand.
In 1899, when Houdini decided to stop doing traditional magic and instead concentrate on escapes, his career took off.

images.alt: Photo of a person looking carefully at the pages of a book.
images.description: A person looks carefully at the pages of a book. He has one hand on the book, and the other hand near the side of his head.
images.caption: A person concentrating on reading a book.

source.title: Photo of Man Reading a Book
source.author: Ariel Castillo

examples: In 1899, when Houdini decided to stop doing traditional magic and instead fixate on escapes, his career took off.

images.alt: Photo of a person looking carefully at the pages of a book.
images.description: A person looks carefully at the pages of a book. He has one hand on the book, and the other hand near the side of his head.
images.caption: A person fixated on reading a book.

source.title: Photo of Man Reading a Book
source.author: Ariel Castillo

examples: In 1908, in St. Louis, Houdini introduced his escape from a giant milk can filled with water.
In 1908, in St. Louis, Houdini unveiled his escape from a giant milk can filled with water.
